intro: Aerva ambigua, commonly known as the Indian nettle or wild nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and wastelands. Aerva ambigua is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
